sect1.title: Migration from HOS 5.x to HOS 5.SCP
sect1.para: The migration procedure is based on the following assumptions.

listitem.para: Customer is responsible for backing up all the control plane and deployer nodes to an external data store before starting migration
We do not support rollback of migration process once started
MML data will not be migrated (HOS 5.SCP includes a new MML backend which will be installed fresh)
Any data not kept on a separate disk from the primary root partition will be lost during reimaging:
Swift objects
Audit logs
All computes are running supported Linux distribution:
SLES12 SP3 for SLES computes
RHEL 7.3 for RHEL computes
Only supported input model services
No embedded HOS Ceph or VSA
Only supported third-party integrations/extensions
No unsupported customized virtual environments

step.para: Run validation playbook to ensure that current cloud load and configuration is compatible with migration process:
step.screen: (old-deployer)$ git clone -b hp/prerelease/newton https://gerrit.suse.provo.cloud/hp/hlm-migration-tools (old-deployer)$ cd hlm-migration-tools/ansible (old-deployer)$ ansible-playbook -i ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible/hosts/verb_hosts pre-migration-validations.yml
step.para: The validation playbook performs the following checks:

listitem.para: Proper HOS 5.0.1/5.0.2 installed version number
C8-compatible Linux distributions on compute nodes
System clock synchronization across cloud nodes
HA capacity of controller nodes (L3/DHCP agent)
HA capacity of controller nodes (Swift)
Data model and Cinder back-end compatibility (no VSA or Ceph)

step.para: Identify a candidate "seed" controller node in the Primary control plane meeting the following requirements:

listitem.para: Networking connectivity is equivalent to that of existing deployer
Member of the database cluster (running MySQL service)
Not actively hosting any singleton Openstack services (cinder-volume or nova-consoleauth), test for empty output using:
Ensure that the data model enables deployer behavior by the new seed node.
Edit the disks_*.yml file that is used by your server role that includes monitoring services, and replace the existing vertica partition definition with two Cassandra partitions:
listitem.screen: - name: cassandra size: (whatever size was used originally by vertica partition, less 1%) mount: /var/cassandra/data fstype: ext4 mkfs-opts: -O large_file consumer: name: vertica - name: cassandra_log size: 1% mount: /var/cassandra/commitlog fstype: ext4 mkfs-opts: -O large_file

listitem.para: Edit ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/control_plane.yml and identify the cluster definition that already includes an entry for mysql in its service-components
